> Powered by [Codecov](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25417?src=pr&el=footer). Last update [f2fbebd...aa5593d](https://codecov.io/gh/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25417?src=pr&el=lastupdated). Read the [comment docs](https://docs.codecov.io/docs/pull-request-comments).

Do we want this as a "required" test dependency?

Also, why was pytest-mock needed? Was something not working with unittest.mock?

this is already added 

unittest.mock is not always available PY2 and is not useful with pytest (gets was broken)

What's "gets"?

Previously, we had a mock fixture that provided unittest.mock if it was
present, and skipped if not (py2).

From the diff in https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/pull/25346/files it
doesn't seem like we're using any of the pytest-specific features of
pytest-mock.
OK to revert those and just use unittest.mock when we drop python 2?



On Thu, Mar 7, 2019 at 11:04 AM Jeff Reback <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> this is already added
>
> unittest.mock is not always available PY2 and is not useful with pytest
> (gets was broken)
